subtopic: C3 vs C4 photosynthesis and stomatal conductance
main_point: The professor explains C3 vs C4 photosynthesis and stomatal conductance and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes nutrient uptake (a process) from phloem (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving photorespiration and stomata.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a funding detail to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for conductance shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
